page.title: 17BADLUARACH/SCORAIG-HOUSING
page.content: MOST OF THE HOUSES ON BOTH SIDES OF LITTLE LOCH BROOM ARE OF THE TRADITIONAL CROFT HOUSE VARIETY.BUILT OF LOCAL SANDSTONE ABOUT THE START OF THE CENTURY,THEY CONSIST OF 2 ROOMS DOWNSTAIRS AND 2 ROOMS UPSTAIRS. THE BIGGER HOUSES HAVE A SMALL KITCHEN OR PANTRY BEHIND THE STAIRCASE,WITH A THIRD BEDROOM ABOVE.SOME HOUSES HAVE A PORCH AT THE FRONT DOOR WHICH GIVES EXTRA SPACE AND PROTECTION AGAINST THE PREVAILING WIND. AT BADLUARACH A NEW HOUSE HAS BEEN BUILT ON TRADITIONAL LINES BUT CONSTRUCTED WITH CONCRETE BLOCKS. ON SCORAIG A CONCRETE DOME HAS BEEN BUILT AS A DWELLING-HOUSE.THERE IS A LARGE CENTRAL LIVING ROOM WITH LARDER AND BATHROOM LEADING OFF.THE UPPER FLOOR BEDROOM IS SUSPENDED FROM THE CEILING BY STEEL CABLES.
